title: How to Sew a Funny Doll

steps.headline: Gather your fabric and sewing supplies.
Fold the fabric in half.
steps.description: Pin it together to hold it in place.

steps.headline: Draw a funny design on the fabric with a pencil.
steps.description: Keep the design inside the pinned area.

steps.headline: Transfer the pins to hold the fabric inside the design.
steps.description: Cut out the design, leaving a half-inch (1.2 cm) seam allowance on all sides.

steps.headline: With right sides together, stitch the two pieces of fabric together, leaving a small opening.
steps.description: Use double stitching. This will prevent the seams from coming apart. Place tiny equidistant (0.25"/0.8 cm) slits along the very edge of any curve to help create a more uniform shape. This will allow the fabric to curve when it is turned inside out.

steps.headline: Turn the doll right side out and iron it flat.
Stuff the doll using the stuffing stick.
steps.description: Make cotton ball sized pieces to make it easier to position and fill uneven spots.

steps.headline: Tuck in a half-inch of fabric along the opening and stitch the opening together.
steps.description: Use a ladder stitch to make an invisible seam if you prefer.

steps.headline: Add eyes, beads, buttons, bows or sequins.
steps.description: Stitch them on by hand to secure them in place. Add any other accessories like a hat or scarf.

text: Gather your fabric and sewing supplies.  Fold the fabric in half. Pin it together to hold it in place. Draw a funny design on the fabric with a pencil. Keep the design inside the pinned area. Transfer the pins to hold the fabric inside the design. Cut out the design, leaving a half-inch (1.2 cm) seam allowance on all sides. With right sides together, stitch the two pieces of fabric together, leaving a small opening. Use double stitching. This will prevent the seams from coming apart. Place tiny equidistant (0.25"/0.8 cm) slits along the very edge of any curve to help create a more uniform shape. This will allow the fabric to curve when it is turned inside out. Turn the doll right side out and iron it flat.  Stuff the doll using the stuffing stick. Make cotton ball sized pieces to make it easier to position and fill uneven spots. Tuck in a half-inch of fabric along the opening and stitch the opening together. Use a ladder stitch to make an invisible seam if you prefer. Add eyes, beads, buttons, bows or sequins. Stitch them on by hand to secure them in place. Add any other accessories like a hat or scarf.
